title: Airway and breathing check
question: A person lies motionless on the ground. What is your first step?
explain: Always check for consciousness and breathing first by loudly addressing the person and observing chest movements.

title: Severe bleeding
question: How do you stop severe spurting bleeding on a leg initially?
explain: Direct pressure and a pressure bandage are the most effective way to control arterial bleeding. Washing the wound delays clotting.

title: Recognising a stroke
question: Which signs are part of the FAST test for stroke?
choices: Facial droop, arm weakness, speech disturbance
Chest pain, shortness of breath, nausea
explain: FAST stands for Face, Arm, Speech: one side of the face droops, weakness or numbness in the arm and slurred or garbled speech.

title: Hypoglycemia
question: What should you give a diabetic with low blood sugar who is responsive?
choices: A sugary drink or glucose tablets
explain: For low blood sugar, give the person a quick source of sugar such as juice, cola or glucose tablets.
